oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A Zn2+ specific triazole based calix[4]arene conjugate (L) as a fluorescence sensor for histidine and cysteine in HEPES buffer milieu
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PATHAK, RK
TABBASUM, K
RAI, A
PANDA, D
RAO, CP
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: EXCITATORY AMINO-ACIDS
SELECTIVE RECOGNITION
OXIDATIVE STRESS
METAL DETOXIFICATION
L-TRYPTOPHAN
ZINC
METALLOTHIONEIN
CHEMOSENSOR
CALIXARENES
DERIVATIVES
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A highly fluorescent Zn2+ complex of the triazole linked salicyl-imino-thiophenyl conjugate of calix[4] arene, [ZnL] has been demonstrated to be a chemo-sensing ensemble for the recognition of His and Cys among the naturally occurring amino acids in HEPES buffer milieu. The recognition behaviour of the [ZnL] towards these amino acids has been shown on the basis of fluorescence, absorption and visual fluorescent colour changes. The species of recognition were shown by ESI MS titrations, AFM & TEM microscopy and cell studies.
